name: Bed & Breakfast La Romea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A truly unique hotel. The rooms were fabulous as was the breakfast.
reviews.title: A beautiful hotel, hospitality could not be faulted.

reviews.text: Ideally situated in the centre of the old town Would definitely recommend
reviews.title: Delightful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights here in Lucca and have no complaints. The breakfasts were fabulous (fresh fruit, breads, and even eggs to order) and the hospitality was excellent. They also have wireless internet reception from the room, which was excellent. The AC worked well and the room was spacious for all our suitcases. The small refrigerator had room for us to store our own bottles of water and juice. The location is near shops and restaurants. The owners helped us get our train connections and taxis when we needed them. Beautiful place and delightful town!
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: my husband and i stayed here for 3 nights last weekend after spending 4 nights in hotel carignano just outside lucca to attend a family wedding. la romeo is lovely and we stayed in the ivory room which was really beautiful. the owners guillo and gaia are so helpfull with advice on restaurants, getting us timetables for trains and buses to florence which we went to and really enjoyed but we were glad to get back to lucca . it is a beautiful city with so much to do and the narrow streets full of tuscan character. we will be back and wud stay in la romeo again, oh and not forgetting the gorgeous breakfasts and the two lovely ladies who served them, gaias mam and friend, we say thank you so much.
reviews.title: Clean, charming B&B but could use a little better customer service

reviews.text: La Romea is a cute little B&B in the wonderful town of Lucca. Lucca is a great hub for exploring Florence, Cinque Terre and Pisa by day trips.
reviews.title: A Lovely Time

reviews.text: We spent 3 nights in Lucca at La Romea in the Red Room. It was a lovely B&B, although one must remember that it is a B&B and not a hotel. The breakfast was the highlight - much more than offered at most hotels we stayed in throughout Italy. The owners met us at the entrance to Lucca and helped us park our car and drove us to the B&B. There are several stairs to climb to reach the main door, which could be difficult for some. The Red Room was nice - although not as wonderful as I expected (given previous reviews here). We left the windows open for air during the day and were kept awake most nights by flies buzzing around. We also could have used additional pillows - there was not anyone around to ask, except in the morning (we were out during the daytime hours). We did not like the floor of the shower - we bring this up because it has been mentioned by many previous guests - and after walking all day, it was hard to find 2 stones of equal size to balance on and sooth our tired feet. The area restaurants were delicious and the nightly opera was wonderful.
reviews.title: Lovely B&B

reviews.text: We researched long and hard to find a very special B&B in Lucca for a week's stay for our wedding trip in September this year. La Romea looked good and had good reviews... but nothing prepared us for the welcome, hospitality, love and care that we received.
reviews.title: 1st class special Italian hospitality

likes.liked: — Beautiful, clean, comfortable, hospitable, individual, central, Italian

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot recommend them highly enough...our hosts, the young Italian owners, Gaia and her husband, Giulio are not only charming and friendly, but also totally professional and experienced in their business. They have that special knack of knowing what you might need before you ask... it is something that only true hospitality people know how to do. Never intrusive, but always attentive.
reviews.title: A gem of a B&B

likes.liked: — History combined with comfort and style.
likes.disliked: — The noise from the outdoor cinema in a nearby square.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B has only 5 rooms, but each one is so carefully and beautifully decorated and serviced, and always immaculately clean, they are all lovely. We stayed in both the Red room (for 2 nights) and the Blue room (the suite for another 4 nights), both are lovely, but the Blue room is a wonderful suite with extra space and a fabulously interesting and unusual bathroom on a split level. Very comfortable (firm) mattresses for a great night's sleep.
reviews.title: A view from the ivory room
La Brilliant Boheme in lovely Lucca
reviews.text: The location is perfect - right in the centre of Lucca, in the middle of everything you need to see and all within walking distance. The taxi can even get to the front door with your luggage. It's ideally situated and your hosts will give you a map and tell you where to go and what you might like to see. (and Lucca is fabulous - there's LOTS to see!)
We arrived to a very warm welcome from both Giulio and Gaia the owners of this former 14th century palace. No lifts back then and none now but dont let that bother you at all as its only 1 floor up.
reviews.title: Eggs and Coffee mmmmmmmmmmmmm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was airy and spacious tastfully decorated, clean and complete with tv, mini bar and lovely en suite.
reviews.title: wonderful

likes.disliked: — the neighbour's air conditioning was a little noisy...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is wonderful, only 2 mins walk to the Guinigi Tower and less
reviews.title: Exceptional service

reviews.text: to the main shopping street. Despite its central location the hotel was quiet and relaxing.
reviews.title: Brilliant

likes.disliked: — The AC was a little noisy and a remote for it would have been brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now on to the best bit, if you like eggs you will love this place. How do you like them? Just say and they will do them for you, alongside breakfast buffet of cereal, breads, meats, fresh fruit and the best coffee in Lucca.
reviews.title: Excellent!

likes.liked: — The location - right in the heart of town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week at the La Romea B&B in Lucca, Tuscany. The accommodation was found by looking at the Trip Advisor Hotels and B&Bs for Lucca. Our own reflections more than match the excellent comments that we had seen on the Trip Advisor reports. This is indeed excellent accomodation.
reviews.title: A Crown in the Jewel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room ( The yellow room) was large and with King Size comfortable bed, the room was air conditioned ( needed because average outside temp during our stay was 34%). Large en-suite shower room. The La Romea is ideally situated in the heart of the town and is on the second floor of a converted Palace building. The buffet style breakfasts are exceptional and provide a real glow to the start of your day. The owners are a married couple with a young family who cannot do enough to help you enjoy your stay. Lucca itself is a magical place within easy reach of both Pisa and Florence. If we return to the area as I am sure we will,then La Romea will certainly be our first choice accommodation.
reviews.title: La Romea - a great choice for Lucca

reviews.text: La Romea is a very good choice if you are looking for quality accommodation at a reasonable price in Lucca.
reviews.title: Charming Inn!

likes.liked: — Lovely inn with a very friendly and helpful staff

reviews.text: The hosts are charming & friendly & go out of their way to help.
reviews.title: Blue Sky room was perfect

reviews.text: Our bedroom (ivory room) was nicely furnished & had a large modern bathroom. It was also very quiet.
reviews.title: Incredible Location, Great Breakfasts in Italy's Best-Kept Secret---Lucca!!

likes.liked: — The perfect location and wonderful breakfasts
likes.disliked: — The owners telling me I should call the Visitor Center when I asked them to recommend a tour guide--a major no-no in the hospitality business.

description: The Bed and Breakfast La Romea is a typical exemple of historic residence, located on the first floor of a late XIVth century palace in Via Sant'Andrea, a short walk fron the Guinigi Tower. Guests will be welcome in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere at the hart of the medieval town. The spacious living room gives room for your private meetings and a wonderful breakfast. We can organize Baby sitting as well as Dog sitting, please ask the reception. We can organize for transportation to and from the two major airports of Pisa and Firenze.
